data.title: Children Class Nodes Can't Display Parent Classes' Exports
data.body:
Hey, there. So basically, if you have a node that's running a script that extends a parent's script, and that parent' script exports a variable, it won't reliably display in the "child" node. It can display after reloading the scene, but disappears again after you save.

Here's a forum thread talking about the problem.

http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=980

data.title: Memory leak when loading and unloading a scene
data.body:
When loading and unloading a scene in a loop, the memory used by the scene is not freed.

Demo here:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/20414611/test_3d_memory_leak.zip

Result with godot -v , under Ubuntu 14.04 64 bits with the last build of Godot engine (v1.0.3917-beta1):

data.title: Fail to create Frame Buffer
data.body: I was working on "Creating a 2D Game" tutorial and when I typed in the script using the "if statement" I noticed it was red-lining it, and when I tried to compile it, I get an error that says, Failure to create framebuffer.

data.title: [GFX] - 3D Sprite Catches its Own Shadow
data.body:
Hey. So if you have a 3D billboarded sprite and make it cast shadows by enabling "Cast Shadow" on the Geometry and turn on the "Shaded" flag, the shadow it casts touches the sprite as well. In the image, the problem can be seen on the right, where the sprite's shadow partially touches the sprite. 

![spritecatchesshadow](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4733521/4527248/06e4af80-4d66-11e4-846a-e5b7e44d64dd.png)

It should appear as the left half of the image shows, where the sprite doesn't get shaded by its own shadows at all.

P.S. Thank you for implementing the 3D sprite system. It's really great that its shadows stay "full" and don't alter as the sprite faces the camera, too. Thanks so much!

data.title: Highlith for built-in types in Script Editor also missing keyword not
data.body:
It would be helpful if Built-in types like int, float, NodePath etc. would be color highlighted in Script Editor.
Maybe built-in enums like FILE, DIR, RGBA and soo should be highlighted too?

"not" keyword is missing highlight.

data.body:
This pic show a custom theme, when the stretched slice of image is less than original size some issues occurs.
Some texture filters like nearest filter can be ussed solve it?

data.title: Capsule Collision Shape
data.body:
Hi, I know this issue was already posted in #421 but I don't know how to reopen it and i think this should be fixed.

When you add a CapsuleShape as a Collision shape you get 2 handles in the editor, one for radius and another for height, the radius one works, but when the height one is pressed it just goes to height:0.002. So it's useless

BoxShape, CapsuleShape, SphereShape and RayShape all have some handles in the editor from which you can edit its geometry. So this issue causes inconsistency.

data.title: Few 3D viewport selection bugs and usability problems
data.body:
Sorry that I stacked all of them here. I can separate each one to it's own report if there is need for it.

Bug 1:
I can't select instanced scenes in 3D view-port by clicking their meshes. (_Edit:_ now in #2852)

Bug 2:
When zoomed out it's impossible to select  some smaller objects. I'm not talking about 5px objects of course, they are reasonably big on screen to be selectable by user.

Problem 1:
Current way of indicating which objects are selected is not very useful, the bounding box corners are not very noticeable (actually not visible in light scenes) and it's often hard to see if I selected mesh or lamp even.
Would suggest some sort of coloured outline around mesh objects and maybe sprite display change for lamps and stuff.
Additional benefit from outline is when working with stacked, intersecting meshes. User can then see borders of the object he manipulates and it's easier for him to see what he is doing.

Problem 2:
Awesome feature of Select Mode (Q) is that it can do bounding box selection, helps with selecting multiple or small objects, but it doesn't work if there are other objects behind object we want to select.
It then selects that "behind object" and because current nature of this tool automatically transforms it to the movement of the mouse, so there is no way to use bounding box selection in most scenes.

I would suggest to separate selection from multi transform tool and make it more like ON/OFF mode for transform gizmos. It would also help if user wants, for example, only translate objects that he selects, or only select object without seeing any transform widgets on the screen that can stand in the way sometimes.
I can elaborate that idea (visual help what I have in mind?) if that's not enough.

Problem 3:
In 2D there is an option to Lock objects from selection, something like that would be useful for 3D as well.

data.title: 3D nodes position sprite icon ON/OFF switching and max size
data.body:
Some nodes like lights use sprites to display their position, but often when zooming out they become so big, compared to rest of the scene, that they are more in the way than help.

They need editable maximum size settings, and ON/OFF switching.

data.title: SamplePlayer2D broken
data.body:
Vague title, I know, but lots of things about it aren't working right.  stop_all isn't stopping sounds that are playing.  the volume db and pitch scale parameters seem to have no effect any more.  Playing a sound with pitch_scale set to the default 1 gives the following message (in the terminal, not in the Godot output panel): ERROR: update: Invalid mix rate for voice (0) check for invalid pitch_scale param.

These have all been seen in Windows 7 and Ubuntu 13.10.

data.title: Icon missing in Tween demo
data.body: The icon is still missing.

data.title: Editable default lighting in 3D viewport
data.body:
Ability to edit default preview lighting in 3D view, would be great.
3 lamp rig setup + ambient light, user should be able to set up positions, colors (diffuse and secularity separate) and their intensities.

data.title: Add an Option to force decode sRGB texture in Editor Viewports
data.body:
Having props/scenes using meshes with sRGB textures leads to the temptation of including a 3D Environment with sRGB "on" in every scenes in order to see the texture correctly inside the Godot editor.

This then leads to 3D Environment conflicts (overriding) when those scenes are imported into a master scene which already have a proper 3D Environment.

Ideally there should be an Editor option to properly display sRGB textures in the editor viewports without having to use a 3D Environment with sRGB "on".

data.title: sRGB -> Linear conversion works only with VRAM compression selected
data.body: as in title

data.title: Alternative to FXAA
data.body: Detect platform support for Depth Buffer/Texture (OES_depth_texture) in order to implement a FXAA alternative that does not blur rendered Textures.

data.title: Text entry bug in editor
data.body:
I confirmed this bug with some folks on IRC, and it seems to be affecting all OSs running a build after the 16 September.

How to reproduce:
Open at least 2 scripts. Type in one of them. Using the tabs, switch to the 2nd one. If you now type, the text is still being entered in the 1st one. It is now required that after switching tab you click to focus the text entry on the 2nd script.

My guess: #588 
We confirmed this in Linux and Win7.

data.title: particle system sprite sheet
data.body: Particles in particle system should be able to use a spritesheet for animated sprites, preferably with a random start for each animation.  Choosing a random single image from the spritesheet would also be useful.

data.title: "Show children" from the node tree bug
data.body:
I've just compiled the latest version. I'm slowly discovering the new features, they are great.

I want to report a problem using the new "Show children" feature (instead of "open in editor") in the nodes tree. I had an AnimationPlayer inside the node I opened with one animation. I've made a few operations: duplicated the animation several times and edit them. 

When I ran the game the animation hadn't changed. Later I chose "open in editor" and all my operations were missing.

That's it.

Cheers

data.title: Jetpack like cam in editor
data.body:
Activates by holding middle mouse. Standard FPS controls with q going
down and e up.

Edit: Everything else continues to work as expected, for example SHIFT + MIDDLE MOUSE to drag view.

data.title: current dir changed after open dir to dir was opened (from v 1.0.3917 beta 1)
data.body:
this issue started from version 1.0.3917 beta 1

The only way to ensure the dir exists is to open it. 
Directory class has no close() method. 
After opening it in some function end then returning from that function it stays as current dir in all file operations, not related on it.

Nothing happen when I click "Import" button, nothing inside the Target folder.
"Import & Open" is working.

When I try replace a material for a surface the editor replace it normally.
But after run the the window and debugger crashes! And I have same crashes when i try to reload the scene!

data.title: warp_mouse_pos for osx
data.body: Just copied windows behavior.

data.title: new relese (godot_win32.exe ) is not launching on windows 8.1 (32bits)
data.body:
Hi All!
I used godot_win32.exe  release from early August and it worked perfectly:), unfortunately yesterday I replaced it with the newest version which is not launching and giving a  windows popup that program stopped working and closing up (the same on Vista). 

I will warmly welcome any support to solve this issue.
 OR
Could you please make the older versions of the released binaries available somewhere, so that I could download it again and continue my project...

Best, 
Aleksandra

Sorry, I downloaded it again (ca 4th time) and this time it has launched successfully.
Please delete.

data.title: 'Error' texture on focused MenuButton
data.body: If I add a MenuButton to a scene and run it, whenever it has keyboard focus a texture with the word 'Error' is overlayed on the button. This occurs this both the default theme and custom themes.

data.title: Missing theme options for slider controls
data.body:
I've been working on making a theme, but I've discovered that Icon → Grabber Hilite is availible when editing an individual slider control but is not available when editing a theme, for both HSliders and VSliders. This makes it difficult to theme sliders, since they'd need to be individually themed for consistency.

In addition, while Styles → Focus is available for HSliders (in both locations), it's not availible for VSliders. I'm not sure if this is intentional, though.

data.title: Running scenes process won't close
data.body:
When hitting run in the editor, a new process appears and the preview window shows up. but when than window is closed, or the stop button is hit in the editor, the process remains
![area de trabajo 1_038](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8909965/4400059/639e7a3a-4479-11e4-9a55-d111cda56dbf.png) I'm using xubuntu 14.04 and everything else in the OS seems fine
